events.description: US-based employers announced 108,435 job cuts in January 2026, the highest January total since 2009.
UPS announced 30,000 job cuts following the end of its relationship with Amazon.
Amazon announced 16,000 job cuts as part of a management layer restructuring.

facts.fact_text: US-based employers announced 108,435 job cuts in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: US-based employers announced 108,435 job cuts in January 2026, the highest level since October and the largest January total since 2009

facts.fact_text: UPS is cutting 30,000 jobs after severing ties with Amazon.

evidences.evidence_text: The company announced it would cut 30K jobs after severing ties with Amazon.

facts.fact_text: Amazon is cutting 16,000 jobs due to management restructuring.

evidences.evidence_text: Technology announced 22,291 job cuts, with the bulk coming from Amazon (16K) as it restructures its layers of management.

facts.fact_text: Employers announced 5,306 hiring plans in January, the lowest since 2009.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, employers announced 5,306 hiring plans, the lowest total for the month since records began in 2009.

claims.claim_text: Employers are less-than-optimistic about the economic outlook for 2026.
claims.author: Andy Challenger

evidences.evidence_text: signaling employers are less-than-optimistic about the outlook for 2026

claims.claim_text: The high number of job cuts in January is an unusual total for the start of the year.
claims.author: Andy Challenger

evidences.evidence_text: Generally, we see a high number of job cuts in Q1, but this is a high total for January.

evidence.evidence_text: US-based employers announced 108,435 job cuts in January 2026, the highest level since October and the largest January total since 2009
Meanwhile, employers announced 5,306 hiring plans, the lowest total for the month since records began in 2009.
The company announced it would cut 30K jobs after severing ties with Amazon.
